column1:
1196,Asthma Emergency Department Visits (Children 5 to 17 Yrs Old),Rate,

Number of asthma-related emergency department (ED) visits among NYC resident children aged 5 to 17 years
column2: divided by the population of children 5 to 17 years old

column1: ED visits include both patients who are treated and released in the ED
column2: (outpatients) and who are admitted as inpatients through the emergency&nbsp

column1: An ED visit is included if it has an ICD-9 principal diagnosis code of 493 or an ICD-10 principal diagnosis code of J45. New York hospitals began using the ICD-10 system on October 1
column2: 2015. Because the ICD systems are similar in how they classify childhood asthma
column3: data can be compared across years.

column2: ,NYS SPARCS Hospitalization,New York State Statewide Planning and Research Cooperative System (SPARCS) Deidentified Hospital Discharge Data,

column1:
1201,Asthma Hospitalizations (Children 5 to 17 Yrs Old),Rate,

Number of asthma-related hospitalizations among NYC resident children aged 5 to 17 years
column2: divided by the population of children 5 to 17 years old
A hospitalization is included if it has an ICD-9 principal diagnosis code of 493 or an ICD-10 principal diagnosis code of J45. New York hospitals began using the ICD-10 system on October 1
column3: 2015. Because the ICD systems are similar in how they classify childhood asthma
column4: data can be compared across years.
